div.p: Upload a management certificate for secure API access to your cloud resources. You can upload a management certificate from either the User Account Quickstart or the Management Certificates pages.

The Management Certificate is used as an authentication mechanism at the API REST layer to allow a subscriber to manage their cloud services and resources. The same Management Certificate can be used with 1 or more subscriptions.
There are several ways to create management certificates, if you have Visual Studio installed you can create a certificate using makecert by following these steps:

ol.li: Open the Visual Studio Command Prompt window as an administrator.
Change the directory to the location where you want to save the certificate file.

Type the following command:
makecert -sky exchange -r -n "CN=<CertificateName>" -pe -a sha1 -len 2048 -ss My "<CertificateName>.cer"
Where <CertificateName> is the name that you want to use for the certificate. It must have a .cer extension.

div.p: After the management certificate has been created, upload the certificate from either the User Account Quickstart or Management Certificates pages.
